title: Chelsea stars drop their shorts and 'sit' on Jorginho during bizarre training session
text:
Chelsea’s new vice-captain got no sympathy from his teammates (Picture: Chelsea TV / YouTube)

Chelsea’s squad looked in high spirits ahead of Sunday’s trip to face Southampton in the Premier League, ribbing newly appointed vice-captain Jorginho during a rondo.

The Blues picked up an important win away to Lille on Wednesday in the Champions League but focus quickly turned to preparing for the weekend’s trip to St Mary’s, with manager Frank Lampard putting the side through their paces.

But there was still time for some fun and games when Jorginho hit the deck and appeared to feign injury after messing up in the rondo, with his teammates mocking him mercilessly.

Tomori pulls his shorts up and runs off after mocking Jorginho (Picture: Chelsea TV / YouTube)

As skipper Cesar Azpilicueta burst out laughing and mimicked his fall to the ground, young centre-back Fikayo Tomori could be seen pulling up his shorts behind him after teasing Jorginho.

Advertisement

Left-back Marcos Alonso followed suit, dropping his shorts and rather bizarrely gyrating over the prone Italian, practically sitting on his face, while Tammy Abraham did a little dance.

Fortunately, Jorginho was not seriously injured and eventually got back to his feet – his pride a little dented – as the session got back underway.

Watch the bizarre moment from 5.14 below…

Interestingly, Chelsea had a special guest visit training this week, with former midfielder Michael Ballack invited to watch the players in action and speaking with several of them afterwards.

Some Chelsea fans also spotted Christian Pulisic’s less-than-impressive outing during the training video, with the American too easily losing possession after being tackled by Michy Batshuayi of all people!
